title: authenticate
description: Authenticate the client
name: authenticate

Parameter.description: The clients public key

query string.description: MD5 hash of token + clients private key

Success 200.description: Indicates if the authentication was successful

If the request is successful you will receive an authToken that should be sent with all requests that require client authentication. This can be sent as either an additional parameter or be included in the request header

Header.description: The format of the output, also application/xml

title: authenticateUser
description: Check if the SmartWaste user has allowed the API client to access their account via the API.
name: authenticateUser

Parameter.description: The username of the user account that is being authenticated. This is a path parameter - see the example below.

Success 200.description: Indicates whether this user has already been authorised or not.
If already authorised, you will receive the details of this user.
If the user has not yet authorised access, you will receive this URL. This URL redirects to a page where the user can allow this API client to access their SmartWaste account.

Header.description: The format of the output, also application/xml
The token received during the authentication process needs to be sent as part of the header OR as a parameter.

title: getCompanies
description: Get the list of companies which exist under the company which is identified by {cid}
name: getCompanies

Success 200.description: This contains the details of the companies retrieved.

examples.title: Success-Response:
examples.content:
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
[
    {
        "address1": "11 Industrial Park",
        "address2": "",
        "city": "London",
        "companyID": 17134,
        "companyName": "London Region",
        "companySize": "0-9 employees",
        "companyType": "Architect",
        "contactFirstname": "John",
        "contactSurname": "Smith",
        "county": "Greater London",
        "email": "john.smith@company.co.uk",
        "phone": "",
        "postCode": "SE12HD",
        "web": "www.company.co.uk/london"
    },
    {
        "address1": "4 High Street",
        "address2": "",
        "city": "Cambridge",
        "companyID": 17135,
        "companyName": "South East Region",
        "companySize": "0-9 employees",
        "companyType": "Architect",
        "contactFirstname": "Adam",
        "contactSurname": "Smith",
        "county": "Cambridgeshire",
        "email": "adam.smith@company.co.uk",
        "phone": "",
        "postCode": "CB13DS",
        "web": "www.company.co.uk/southeast"
    }
]

Header.description: The format of the output, also application/xml
The token received during the authentication process needs to be sent as part of the header OR as a parameter.
Username for the SmartWaste account being used needs to be sent as part of the header OR as a parameter.

title: getDefaultCompanies
description: Get the details of the default company/companies which the user has access to. This is the first call the API user needs to make to get the Company IDs needed to use the API.
name: getDefaultCompanies

Success 200.description: This contains the details of the companies retrieved.
